title: Activate tenants
content:
You can activate a deactivated tenant. After the tenant is activated, it is provisioned successfully, and the system can process the tenant requests.

The following command activates the specified tenants: 

./op-tms-cli tenant activate -f inputs-short.yaml [-s] [-r]

where the different options available are:

Options Description
-f or --file path to the input YAML file that contains the tenant configurations.
-s or --silent option to run the command in silent mode where you are not prompted to pass any parameter values on CLI.
-r or --override option to provide passwords as part of the command and override the environment passwords set.

The command activates the tenant from OPTIC Data Lake, then Operations Cloud, and then IDM. Once a tenant is activated, you receive a similar response:

Starting tenant activate...
 
Executing tenant activation chain...
TenantOne  -  Activate tenant tasks initiated
TenantOne  -  Waiting for ODL tenant to be activated
  This may take few minutes...
TenantOne  -  ODL tenant activated
TenantOne  -  Waiting for UIS tenant to be activated
  This may take few minutes...
TenantOne  -  UIS tenant activated
TenantOne  -  IDM organization activated
TenantOne  -  Activate tenant tasks completed
 
 
Tenant activate completed

Here, TenantOne is an example of the tenant name.

You can run the following command to check the tenant state:

./op-tms-cli tenant exist -f inputs-short.yaml
